channel.title: Eritque Arcus Math Notes
channel.description: Last 10 notes on Eritque Arcus Math Notes

item.title: index
item.description: This note is outcome of Spring 25 CS 450. Numerical Analysis in UIUC taught by instructor Paul Fischer. The book is Scientific Computing: An Introductory Survey, Revised Second Edition Topics by type recap Type of matrix: Orthogonal matrix Symmetric positive definite matrix (SPD) Band matrix Factorization: LU factorization Cholesky factorization Singular value decomposition QR factorization Topics by Chapter Chapter 1: Chapter 2: LU factorization Symmetric positive definite matrix Cholesky factorization Band matrix Forward-backward substitution Chapter 3 - Linear Least Squares Problem (LLSQ): pseudo inverse (Moore-Penrose Inverse) Singular value decomposition .

item.title: Orthogonal matrix
item.description: A is m\times n Definition A^TA=I Features \det(A) = \pm1 A^{-1} = A^T .

item.title: pseudo inverse (Moore-Penrose Inverse)
item.description: for m \times n matrix A has no inverse. if rank(A) = n we can say A^+ = (A^TA)^{-1}A^T and cond(A) = ||A^T||_2 \cdot ||A^+||_2. if rank(A) < n, we can say cond(A) = \infty.

item.title: Symmetric positive definite matrix
item.description: A is m\times n matrix Definition A = A^T and (\forall x \neq 0) x^TAx > 0 Features For all 0 < i < n Diagonal entries a_{ii} > 0 Eigenvalues \lambda_i > 0 Condition number ...

item.title: Cholesky factorization
item.description: This is a special case for LU factorization (U = L^T). A=LL^T where A m\times n is SPD 2x2 example L = \begin{bmatrix} x & 0 \\ y & z \end{bmatrix} L^T = \begin{bmatrix} x & y \\ 0 & z \end{bmatrix} so A = LL^T = \begin{bmatrix} x^2 & xy \\ xy & y^2 + z^2 \end{bmatrix} \square Costs Only lower triangular part of A is accessed, so only \frac{1}{2} the storage is required.

item.title: Band matrix
item.description: A is m\times n Definition (\forall |j - i| > b)a_{ij} = 0 Costs Storage/solve cost is \approx 2nb LU factorization cost for Band matrix is \approx 2nb^2 operations ...

item.title: index
item.description: This note is outcome of Fall 24 Math 444. Elementary Real Analysis in UIUC, taught by professor Marius Junge. The number after sub-heading indicates the number of class(e.g.

item.title: Singular value decomposition
item.description: A = U\Sigma V^T where A is m\times n U: An m\times m Orthogonal matrix matrix whose columns are the left singular vectors of A. \Sigma: A diagonal m\times n matrix containing the singular values of A in descending order.

item.title: QR factorization
item.description: A = QR where: A is m\times n R is right upper Q is Orthogonal matrix Steps Householder.
